    • Method Detail

      • parseOptions

        public void parseOptions(java.lang.String[] argv)
        Parse the vector of command line arguments into options and store these options in a HashMap. A command line option must start with a dash ("-") and may have an argument (which must not start with a dash). Options without arguments are considered boolean. Note that it is not possible to provide a list of non-option arguments.
        Parameters:
        argv - the vector of command line arguments

      • getOptions

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Comparable> getOptions()
        Return the options HashMap.
        Returns:
        the options HashMap

      • getStringOption

        public java.lang.String getStringOption(java.lang.String name)
        Returns an option value as String.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the option
        Returns:
        the option value as String or null if the option is not provided by the user.

      • getBooleanOption

        public boolean getBooleanOption(java.lang.String name)
        Returns an option value as boolean value.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the option is provided, false otherwise
